content:
• Tuesday, November 21, 2017
  • PDFS

    PDF Solutions, Consol Energy spin-off to join SmallCap 600

    • PDF Solutions (NASDAQ:PDFS) is replacing Black Box (NASDAQ:BBOX) in the S&P SmallCap 600, S&P says, with Black Box no longer representative of the small-cap market space (it has a market cap below $60M).
    • Black Box finished the regular session up 15.3% and postmarket trading up 4.7%.
    • In another move tied to Consol Energy's (NYSE:CNX) separation into two publicly traded companies, the new Consol Energy (the former Consol Mining, (NYSE:CEIX)) will replace Iconix Brand Group (NASDAQ:ICON) in the SmallCap 600.
    • After the spin-off, the newly named CNX Resources will stay in the MidCap 400 and be reclassified into the Oil & Gas Exploration and Production area.
    • Iconix finished the regular session up 12.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:34 PM | 1 Comment
  • TIVO

    TiVo +6.8% as ITC rules Comcast infringed on patents

    • TiVo (NASDAQ:TIVO) is rallying strong after hours, up 6.8%, after an International Trade Commission ruling saying Comcast (NASDAQ:CMCSA) violated two of its patents.
    • Comcast's set-top boxes infringed on the patents of TV-guide company Rovi Corp., now part of TiVo.
    • The ITC issued an exclusion order banning Comcast from importing and selling infringing X1 boxes, TiVo says.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:53 PM | 5 Comments
  • SSY

    SunLink Health Systems launches $2.5M buyback tender; shares +5.3%

    • SunLink Health Systems (NYSEMKT:SSY) has launched a tender offer to buy back up to 1,562,500 of its common shares.
    • Shares are up 5.3% after hours.
    • The offer comes at $1.60/share, making for an aggregate purchase price of $2.5M. Shares closed yesterday at $1.49 and finished up 2% today to $1.52; postmarket quotes are coming at $1.60.
    • The buyback covers about 17.05% of outstanding common shares. Officers and directors expect to tender 2,136,963 shares in connection with the offer.
    • It will be funded with part of the company's $8.6M in unrestricted cash.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:46 PM
  • SE

    Sea Limited declines postmarket amid $127M loss

    • Sea Limited (NYSE:SE) ADRs are off 1.9% in postmarket trade after posting its first earnings report since an Oct. 20 initial public offering.
    • GAAP revenues were $94.1M and adjusted net loss came to $127.1M. Revenues with addbacks of digital entertainment deferred revenue and e-commerce commission income rose 73%, to $151.7M.
    • In Digital Entertainment, Garena quarterly active users were up 54% Y/Y to 69M, monthly active users in the last month up 61% to 42.7M, and quarterly paying users rose 38% to 6.5M.
    • In E-Commerce, gross merchandise value at Shopee rose 219% Y/Y to $1.065B. Gross orders were up 204% to 65.9M.
    • Cash and equivalents came to $581.5M, not including proceeds of $939.9M from the Oct. 20 IPO.
    • For the full year, it expects GAAP revenue (plus change in Digital Entertainment deferred revenue and E-Commerce commission income) to be $540M-$550M, growth of 53-56% Y/Y.
    • Conference call to come at 7 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 6:39 PM
  • CPRT

    Copart beats by $0.06, beats on revenue

    • Copart (NASDAQ:CPRT): Q1 EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.06.
    • Revenue of $419.17M (+21.2% Y/Y) beats by $38.13M.
    • Shares +2% AH.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 6:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • MRVL

    Bloomberg: Starboard to vote for Marvell-Cavium deal

    • Major Marvell Technology (NASDAQ:MRVL) stakeholder Starboard Value says it's going to vote for the $6B merger with Cavium (CAVM), according to Bloomberg.
    • Marvell confirmed the cash and stock deal yesterday, valuing Cavium at $80/share.
    • As of two days ago, Starboard reported holding about 6.9% of Marvell.
    • Cavium shares are up 14.8% over the past two days since news of the deal broke, and rose 3.8% today. Marvell shares are up 12.7% over the two days and finished up 7.8% today.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:57 PM

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: TIVO +7.6%. GME +4.3%. AXTA +3.6%. HAIN +2.2%. EMES +2.0%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: GES -12.0%. CAL -9.7%. DRYS -7.6%HPE -6.1%. BZUN -4.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM
  • AXTA

    Axalta flips to green on Reuters report of Nippon Paint offer

    • Axalta Coating Systems (NYSE:AXTA), down as much as 14% after-hours following news that merger talks with Akzo Nobel (OTCQX:AKZOF, OTCQX:AKZOY) had collapsed, turns +2.9% as Reuters reports AXTA received another offer.
    • Japan’s Nippon Paint Holdings made an all-cash offer today to acquire AXTA, which caused the U.S. company to cancel talks with Akzo, according to the report.
    • Nippon’s offer came at a premium to where Axalta shares ended trading yesterday, Reuters says.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM
  • CRM

    Salesforce -1.1% after Q3 beats, mixed guidance

    • Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) shares are down 1.1% aftermarket after Q3 results that beat revenue and EPS estimates but featured mixed guidance. Q4 guidance has revenue from $2.801B to $2.811B (consensus: $2.79B) with EPS from $0.32 to $0.33 (consensus: $0.34).
    • In-line FY19 guidance has revenue from $12.45B to $12.50B compared to the $12.48B consensus. 
    • Key metrics: Subscription and support revenue, $2.49B (+25% Y/Y); Professional services and other revenue, $194M (+20%); deferred revenue, $4.39B (+24%); unbilled deferred revenue, $11.5B (+34%). 
    • Financials: Cash from operations, $126M (-18%); cash and equivalents, $3.63B; operating expenses, $1.85B.    
    • Press release         
    • Previously: Salesforce.com beats by $0.02, beats on revenue (Nov. 21)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:18 PM | 26 Comments
  • HPE

    Hewlett Packard Enterprise -6% on Q4 beats, downside guidance, CEO change

    • Hewlett Packard Enterprise (NYSE:HPE) shares are down 6% aftermarket following Q4 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates but included downside guidance.
    • Q1 guidance has EPS from $0.20 to $0.24 (consensus: $0.27) and FY18 guidance has EPS from $1.15 to $1.25 (consensus: $1.20). 
    • Enterprise Group revenue was up 1% on the year in constant currency to $6.9B with a 10.6% operating margin. Servers revenue fell 5%, Storage was up 5%, Networking was up 21%, and Technology Services revenue grew 2%. 
    • Financial Services revenue was up 24% to $1B.  
    • The company announces that current President Antonio Neri will become President and CEO effective February 1. Current CEO Meg Whitman will remain on the board of directors.  
    • Press release     
    • Previously: Hewlett Packard Enterprise beats by $0.03, beats on revenue (Nov. 21)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM | 25 Comments
  • GES

    Guess? -12% as Americas retail revenue sinks 13%, comp sales -10%

    • Guess (NYSE:GES) -12.2% after-hours as Q3 earnings match estimates but revenues fall short of expectations, and the company guides the midpoint of Q4 revenues well below consensus.
    • Retail revenue in the America remains weak, falling 13.4% Y/Y in U.S. dollars and 14.3% in constant currency during Q3, and retail comp sales including e-commerce slid 10% in U.S. dollars and 11% in constant currency.
    • Results continue to be more promising in Europe and Asia, where Q3 revenues were up 19% and 17%, respectively, mainly driven by new store openings and positive comp sales.
    • Operating margin in the Americas Retail segment improved 240 bps to -2.5% in Q3 from -4.9% in the prior-year quarter, but margin for Europe fell 320 bps to 3.0% from 6.2% a year ago.
    • For Q4, GES sees EPS of $0.48-$0.55 vs. $0.52 analyst consensus estimate and revenues +10%-12% to $647M-$761M vs. $753M consensus.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM | 14 Comments
  • HPQ

    HP -5.2% after Q4 beats, in-line guidance, and flat Commercial hardware

    • HP (NYSE:HPQ) shares are down 5.2% aftermarket following Q4 results that beat revenue estimates but came in-line on EPS. Slight growth in the tightened PC market was offset by stalled Commercial hardware growth.
    • Q1 guidance has EPS from $0.40 to $0.43 (consensus: $0.42) while FY18 guidance has EPs of $1.75 to $1.86 (consensus: $1.79).
    • Personal Systems segment revenue was up 14% on the year in constant currency with a 3.8% operating margin. The segment broke down into a 11% Commercial revenue growth and 18% Consumer growth. Total units rose 6% with Notebooks +8% and Desktops +2%. 
    • Printer revenue was up 7% with a 16.6% operating margin. Total hardware was up 3% due to Consumer units since Commercial units were flat. Supplies revenue rose 11%.  
    • Financials: cash from operating activities, $3.7B; FCF, $0.4B; accounts receivable, $4.4B; inventory, $5.8B; accounts payable, $13.3B; cash and equivalents, $1.1B.    
    • Press release       
    • Previously: HP EPS in-line, beats on revenue (Nov. 21)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 11 Comments
  • GME

    GameStop +3.4% as another gain in same-store sales drives Q3 beat

    • GameStop (NYSE:GME) has settled into strong gains after hours, up 3.4%, after solid beats in its Q3 earnings report driven by its third straight quarter of same-store sales growth.
    • Sales of the Nintendo Switch and collectibles were a bright spot along with new game software, mitigating a slowdown in used-game products.
    • “As we enter the fourth quarter, we are encouraged by the initial customer response to Microsoft’s Xbox One X, and believe that the holiday season results will be driven by new console hardware and collectibles," says interim CEO Dan DeMatteo.
    • EPS rose more than 10% as net earnings increased to $55.1M on an adjusted basis.
    • Overall sales were up 1.5% (flat in constant currency) to $1.99B; comparable store sales were up 1.9% (+0.6% in U.S., +4.6% internationally).
    • Net sales breakout: New videogame hardware, $309.5M (up 8.8%); New videogame software, $649.9M (up 5.4%); pre-owned and value videogame products, $458.5M (down 2.5%); Videogame accessories, $136.4M (down 12.6%); Digital, $37.2M (down 16.8%); Technology brands, $194.2M (down 10.2%); Collectibles, $138.4M (up 26.5%); Other, $64.5M (up 4.4%).
    • It's reiterated full-year guidance for EPS of $3.10-$3.40 (vs. $3.34 expected) and forecasts full-year comparable-store sales to rise in low to mid-single digits.
    • Conference call to come at 5 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM | 24 Comments
  • DRYS

    DryShips slides 11% as losses triple in Q3

    • DryShips (NASDAQ:DRYS) has tumbled after hours, -10.8%, after q3 earnings where voyage revenues rose but net loss tripled amid heavy financing losses.
    • Net loss attributable to common stockholders widened to $15.2M from a year-ago loss of $5.8M.
    • Depreciation rose to $5.5M from a year-ago $872,000. The company also saw higher interest and finance costs (of $3.6M) and took a $7.6M loss on private placement.
    • Average number of drybulk vessels rose to 21.8 from a year-ago 19.7, with total voyage days rising to 2,002 from 1,353, and fleet utilization rose to 100% from 75%.
    • Meanwhile, 4 new tanker vessels were online on average, with 368 voyage days and 100% utilization, and 1.2 gas carrier vessels, with 111 voyage days and also 100% utilization.
    • Time charter equivalent revenue by segment: Drybulk, $17.13M (up 268%); Tanker, $4.02M (new); Gas Carrier, $3.13M (new).
    • Cash and equivalents came to $25.9M. Book value of vessels, including advances, sits at $786.5M, about $7.54/share.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 68 Comments
  • GME

    GameStop beats by $0.11, beats on revenue

    • GameStop (NYSE:GME): Q3 EPS of $0.54 beats by $0.11.
    • Revenue of $1.99B (+1.5% Y/Y) beats by $30M.
    • Shares +10%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 37 Comments
  • DRYS

    DryShips reports Q3 results

    • DryShips (NASDAQ:DRYS): Q3 EPS of -$0.42
    • Revenue of $29.9M (+147.1% Y/Y)
    • Shares +1.8%.
    • Press Release

  • SSNNF

    ITC recommends tariffs on Samsung, LG to benefit Whirlpool

    • The U.S. International Trade Commission recommends tariffs on Samsung (OTC:SSNNF, OTC:SSNLF) and LG to keep inexpensive washers from washing away Whirlpool (NYSE:WHR).  
    • The ITC says the graduated tariff rate should apply to large residential washers above 1.2M units for the next three years. The rate will start at 50% and drop to 40% by the third year.
    • No consensus was reached on import tariffs on fewer than 1.2M units. 
    • President Trump should make the final decision in early 2018. 
    • Whirlpool shares are up 2.3%.  
     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 7 Comments
  • DMPI

    DelMar's lead candidate shows positive action in mid-stage brain cancer study; shares ahead 9%

    • DelMar Pharmaceuticals (DMPI +8.9%) is up on average volume on the heels of its announcement of preliminary results from a 48-subject Phase 2 clinical trial assessing lead candidate VAL-083 in patients with MGMT-unmethylated glioblastoma multiforme (GBM). The data were presented at the Annual Meeting and Education Day of the Society for Neuro-Oncology in San Francisco.
    • 15 patients have been enrolled to date. At the time of the interim analysis, 96% (14/15 = 93% so the origin of 96% is unclear) of enrollees were alive with 40% (n=6/15) showing stable disease. Median survival has not been reached.
    • On the safety front, VAL-083 was well-tolerated with the expected side effect of myelosuppression.
    • VAL-083 (dianhydrogalactitol) is a DNA-targeting agent that introduces interstrand DNA cross-links at the N7-position of guanine leading to DNA double-strand breaks and cancer cell death.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 4 Comments
  • DE

    Deere upgraded at Baird ahead of earnings report

    • Deere (DE +1.7%) rises to a 52-week high a day ahead of its quarterly earnings report, as Baird upgrades shares to Outperform from Neutral with a $155 price target, raised from $140, as equipment dealers are seeing emerging replacement demand, which should provide a boost to sales.
    • Baird analyst Mig Dobre says he previously had downgraded DE on concerns that another record corn crop would pressure prices and push out or hold down the recovery in North American agricultural equipment demand, but equipment demand in October was very strong despite low crop prices.
    • Dobre also notes the 2018 Ag Equipment Intelligence dealer outlook survey showed the best growth outlook since 2012 with meaningful improvement vs. 2017.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • JEC

    Jacobs Engineering +9% after strong quarterly results

    • Jacobs Engineering (JEC +8.9%) surges to a new 52-week high after easily beating FQ4 earnings expectations, as results included sequential revenue growth, a significant increase in backlog and strong margin performance.
    • JEC's record-high $19.8B backlog at the end of the quarter came in well ahead of the $1.2B at the end of FQ3 and slightly more than $1B a year ago.​
    • JEC also issues in-line earnings guidance for FY 2018, seeing EPS of $3.25-$3.60 vs. $3.44 analyst consensus estimate.
    • The company says it is on track to close the CH2M acquisition mid-December.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM | 4 Comments
  • TRIP

    FTC reportedly investigating TripAdvisor's deleted reviews (update)

    • The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) is investigating TripAdvisor (NASDAQ:TRIP) for censoring user reviews containing reports of rape and sexual harassment.
    • The FTC sent a letter to Sen. Tammy Baldwin (D-WI) about the issue and said, “The Commission has a strong interest in protecting consumer confidence in the online marketplace, including the robust online market for hotel and travel. When consumers are unable to post honest reviews about a business, it can harm other consumers whose abilities to make well-informed purchase decisions are hindered and harm businesses that work hard to earn positive reviews.”
    • The FTC news comes from the Milwaukee Journal Sentinel, which originally broke the story that TripAdvisor was removing reviews with the assault claims as well as posts alleging harassment or discrimination.
    • TripAdvisor reacted to the backlash by instituting badges to flag hotels with negative reviews, but the badge expires in three months.
    • Sources: Milwaukee Journal Sentinel / The Verge
    • TripAdvisor shares are up 7.7%.
    • Previously: TripAdvisor down after Q3 revenue miss, Hotel sales drop (Nov. 6)
    • Update with TripAdvisor's statement to Seeking Alpha: "We are not aware of an inquiry by the Federal Trade Commission nor have they contacted us.  TripAdvisor is a global user-generated content platform that enables travelers to post positive and negative reviews and forum content about their experiences.  We receive 290 pieces of content a minute and need to ensure that information posted on our site adheres to our content guidelines to ensure the integrity of these posts.  We stand by our publishing guidelines and how they are applied."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM | 11 Comments
  • CRAY

    Craig Hallum upgrades Cray

    • Craig Hallum upgrades Cray (NASDAQ:CRAY) from Hold to Buy with a $28 price target.
    • Latest analyst recommendations (via FT): 2 Buy, 1 Outperform, and 1 Hold. 
    • Cray shares are up 11.1% to $23.72.    
    • Previously: Cray +3.4% after Q3 beats, in-line guidance (Oct. 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM | 1 Comment

  • WHR

    Whirlpool +2.4% following favorable ITC decision on washer imports

    • Whirlpool (WHR +2.4%) spikes higher on news of a favorable decision on washer imports by the U.S. International Trade Commission.
    • The ITC today recommended an additional 50% tariff on imported Samsung and LG brand washers after WHR urged the imposition of “global safeguard” limits to stop the South Korean companies from flooding the U.S. market with cheap machines.
    • Pres. Trump is expected to make a decision on the recommendation by early next year.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM | 8 Comments
  • CUB

    Cubic +14.6% Q4 beats, $575M contract

    • Cubic (NYSE:CUB) shares are up 14.6% after Q4 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates. FY18 guidance has revenue from $1.51B to $1.56B compared to the $1.56B consensus.
    • The company also announces receiving a $575M contract from the Boston Massachusetts Bay Transportation Authority.
    • The 10-year contract involves designing, building, operating, and maintaining a fare payment system. The contract has two optional five-year extensions.
    • Analyst actions: Needham raises its Cubic price target from $56 to $62.
    • Canaccord Genuity raises its Cubic price target from $55 to $64.
    • Previously: Cubic beats by $0.23, beats on revenue (Nov. 20)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • OSUR

    OraSure up 11% on $143M Oragene Dx supply deal

    • OraSure Technologies (OSUR +11.3%) jumps on more than double normal volume in response to its disclosure that subsidiary DNAG Genotek closed a $143M deal to supply its Oragene Dx devices to a "leading consumer genomics customer."
    • Oragene Dx is an FDA-cleared saliva DNA collection and stabilization device that enables ambient temperature transportation.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM | 3 Comments

    • Gainers: AXU +12%. RYAM +9%. MXC +8%. MTL +8%. AGI +7%.
    • Losers: WLB -24%. EPE -20%. SGY -14%. BBG -9%. SNMX -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • AGI

    Alamos Gold receives final court approval to acquire Richmont Mines

    • Alamos Gold (AGI +6.4%) have been granted final court approval from the Quebec Superior Court of the plan of arrangement whereby Alamos will acquire all of the issued and outstanding shares of Richmont.
    • The Transaction is expected to close on Nov. 23, 2017, subject to applicable regulatory approvals and the satisfaction of other customary conditions.
    • Previously: Alamos Gold acquires Richmont Mines (Sept. 11)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM | 3 Comments
  • SNGX

    Soligenix registers sale of 982K common shares by stockholders; shares down 1%

    • Soligenix (SNGX -0.9%) files an S-1 to register the sale of 982K shares of common stock by existing shareholders.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM | 1 Comment
  • ONTX

    Onconova registers $84.5M mixed shelf offering; shares down 1%

    • Onconova Therapeutics (ONTX -0.7%) files a prospectus (S-3) for an ~$84.5M mixed shelf offering. Net proceeds will fund clinical trials, R&D and general corporate purposes.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM
  • MDXG

    MiMedx down 5% on new Viceroy report of misconduct

    • Embattled MiMedx (OTC:MDXG -4.5%) slumps on lower-than-normal volume on the heels of a November report by Viceroy Research reiterating its accusations of corporate misconduct related sales to the Veterans Administration.
    • It cites a series of emails between the company and the VA related to the arrangement of consignment inventory which it says was contrary to VA policy at that time and corroborates allegations of channel stuffing.
    • Also cited are company emails to former employees related to settlements that were contingent on retracting statements to regulatory authorities that it claims violate federal law and emails from company employees to doctors detailing how to manipulate reimbursement codes for financial gain, a scheme called "up-coding."
     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM | 12 Comments

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM

    • Gainers: GROW +14%. FANH +8%.MHLD +5%.
    • Losers: OPHC -21%. CCCR-OLD -9%. QD -9%. LEJU -8%. CARV -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • PTN

    Palatin establishes bremelanotide distribution in Korea; shares ahead 7%

    • Palatin Technologies (PTN +7.1%) inks a collaboration and license agreement with Kwangdong Pharmaceutical Co., Ltd. for the exclusive rights to develop and commercialize bremelanotide for female sexual dysfunction indications in Korea.
    • Under the terms of the agreement, Palatin will receive $500K upfront, $3M triggered by the first commercial sale, up to $37.5M in sales-related milestones and mid-single-digit-to-low-double-digit royalties on net sales.
    • Bremelanotide is a synthetic peptide analog of the naturally occurring hormone alpha-MSH, a melanocortin agonist. The melanocortin system plays a key role in sexual function as well as pigmentation, inflammation and energy homeostasis.
    • A U.S. marketing application will be filed in Q1 2018.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM | 14 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: CLSN +47%. OTCPK:OMNT +33%. ACHV +26%. ATOM +25%. CADC +20%. EKSO +19%. XNET +18%. CMCM +18%. RELV +17%. CUB +15%.
    • Losers: SIG -28%. CYTK -26%. ACST -25%. OPHC -23%. TEDU -16%. WLB -16%. DSW -12%. OTCQB:MRDN -11%. DCIX -11%. SGY -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM | 3 Comments
  • ARQL

    ArQule launches registration trial for derazantinib in second-line iCCA

    • Dosing is underway in an open-label, single-arm study assessing ArQule's (ARQL -4.6%) derazantinib (ARQ 087) for the treatment of FGFR2 fusion-driven intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma (iCCA). The primary endpoint is objective response rate. According to ClinicalTrials.gov, the estimated primary completion date is September 2020.
    • The company intends to use the data from the 100-subject Phase 3 trial to support a marketing application seeking accelerated approval. An interim analysis will be performed after the first 40 participants have been evaluated for response. In an earlier Phase 1/2 study, the durable response rate was 21%.
    • CCA is also known as bile duct cancer. Intrahepatic CCA occurs within the liver. Other forms of CCA can occur in bile ducts outside of the liver.
    • Derazantinib is a multi-kinase inhibitor designed to selectively inhibit the fibroblast growth factor receptor (FGFR) family. The FGFR pathway is disrupted in cancer, providing a range of therapeutic targets.
    • Shares are down on what appears to be profit-taking after its ~40% run-up this month.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • CREG

    China Recycling Energy +7% on plan to transform into energy storage

    • China Recycling Energy (CREG +7.4%) is higher after announcing plans to transform itself into an "energy storage integrated solution provider."
    • CREG cites results from Yano Economy Research Institute which show the energy storage market enjoying rapid growth and the size of the market in 2017 and 2020 will reach 1.196 GW and 3.307 GW, respectively.
    • CREEG predicts China’s energy storage market will reach 66.8 GW by 2020.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • BLMN

    Bloomin' Brands will 'consider perspectives' of Jana

    • Confirming Jana Partners' 13D filing from yesterday, Bloomin' Brands (NASDAQ:BLMN) says it "appreciates the views of its stockholders and will consider the perspectives reflected" in the filing.
    • Jana plans to push for strategic alternatives, including exploration of a sale.
    • Source: Press Release
    • Shares are down 1.2% today after yesterday's double-digit spike.
    • Previously: Bloomin' Brands spikes after Jana Partners applies pressure (Nov. 20)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: RELV +16%. UQM +13%. MOV +12%. TOUR +10%. KBSF +10%.
    • Losers: CPB -8%. LTEA -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • CELG

    Celgene up 2% after would-be generic competitor misses deadline to file for Revlimid patent challenge

    • Celgene (CELG +2%) heads north, albeit on lower-than-normal volume, after expected generic competitor Dr. Reddy's Laboratories (RDY +4.1%) failed to file for inter partes review of patents covering top seller Revlimid (lenalidomide). Analysts had expected the entry of generics in 2020 but now it appears that the company has a longer runway before it faces the threat.
    • Dr. Reddy's is up in response to the news that the FDA has issued its report (EIR) detailing its findings from an inspection of its Vizag facility in Duvvada, Visakhapatnam. The company intends to request a reinspection of the site in 2018. The FDA issued a Warning Letter to the company in November 2015 related to GMP violations there (as well as two other facilities).
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM | 7 Comments

  • Mexico on the move on Nafta chatter

    • Negotiators are near deals on telecom, energy, and digital commerce, according to Juan Pablo Castanon, chief of Mexico's version of the Chamber of Commerce.
    • The peso is up more than 1% vs. the dollar, and the iShares MSCI Mexico ETF (NYSEARCA:EWW) is higher by 2%.
    • ETFs: EWW, MXF, MXE, DBMX, HEWW, MEXX
     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM | 4 Comments

  • Nasdaq's 1% advance leads averages higher

    • There's green all over the screen, with Apple, Microsoft, Facebook, and Google leading the Nasdaq higher by 1%.

  • CXRX-OLD

    UK competition watchdog focusing on Concordia's liothyronine in ongoing inquiry; shares down 1%

    • In a statement, Concordia International (CXRX-OLD) says the UK Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) has issued a preliminary opinion about possible violations of competition law committed by Cinven, the former owners of the company's international unit Amdipharm Mercury Limited, related to three products, including liothyronine tablets.
    • The CMA is apparently prioritizing liothyronine as it has placed to other two unnamed products on a slower investigative track and a non-priority track, respectively.
    • Concordia also announces that it has commenced court proceedings aimed at realigning its capital structure under Canadian law. The action constitutes a default under each of its agreements covering its 9.00% senior secured notes, 9.50% unsecured notes and currency swaps but the it is protected from legal action from creditors under the Canada Business Corporations Act. The company says it is advancing talks with creditors to reach mutually acceptable decisions on the matter.
    • Shares are off 1% on light volume.
    • Previously: UK competition watchdog launches new inquiry into pharmaceutical arena, Concordia involved (Oct. 11)
    • Previously: Concordia to use court proceeding to restructure debt; trading to resume shortly (Oct. 20)

  • AVXL

    Anavex up 5% premarket on positive data on sigma-1 agonists

    • Thinly traded micro cap Anavex Life Sciences (NASDAQ:AVXL) perks up 5% premarket on light volume on the heels of new data published in Neurotoxicity Research supporting the neuroprotective aspects of sigma-1 agonists, including pipeline candidates ANAVEX 2-73, ANAVEX 1-41 and ANAVEX 3-71.
    • The research confirmed the antioxidant effect and protection of mitochondrial function of sigma-1 agonists in degenerative CNS disorders. For example, oxidative damage occurs in the brains of Alzheimer's disease (AD) sufferers before the appearance of amyloid plaques.
    • Another recent publication in Behavioral Brain Research showed the absence of sigma-1 receptor function exacerbates amyloid toxicity and increases learning impairments in AD mouse models.

  • ARDX

    Ardelyx prepares to launch second late-stage study of hyperphosphatemia med tenapanor, development of hyperkalemia candidate RDX7675 terminated; shares up 7% premarket

    • Ardelyx (NASDAQ:ARDX) is up 7% premarket on modest volume on the heels of its announcement that enrollment will begin shortly in a second Phase 3 study assessing lead candidate tenapanor for the treatment of hyperphosphatemia (excess phosphate in the blood) in end-stage renal disease patients on dialysis. Based on FDA feedback, the new trial will incorporate an active control arm for safety assessment only.
    • The company also announces that it has terminated development of #2 candidate RDX7675 for hyperkalemia (excess potassium in the blood) due to an expected side effect of decreased serum bicarbonate that would limit its use in a chronic setting. It will transition its hyperkalemia development efforts to an earlier-stage small molecule program. Lower-than-normal serum bicarbonate leads to the progression of chronic kidney disease.
    • Previously: Ardelyx selectively reports results from late-stage study to show treatment effect of lead product candidate tenapanor in ESRD patients with elevated serum phosphate (Feb. 15)

  • CYTK

    Cytokinetics stops developing tirasemtiv after failed late-stage ALS study; trading halted

    • Cytokinetics (NASDAQ:CYTK) is facing an ugly day after its announcement that a Phase 3 clinical trial, VITALITY-ALS, evaluating tirasemtiv in patients with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) failed to achieve the primary endpoint of a change in slow vital capacity (SVC) at week 24 versus baseline. None of the secondary endpoints were met either.
    • The decline in SVC from baseline to week 24 was smaller in the treatment group compared to placebo and the largest differences were observed in the mid-dose and high-dose tirasemtiv cohorts but the differences were not statistically significant.
    • Serious adverse events were similar between the treatment and control groups. There were more discontinuations in the tirasemtiv cohorts due to tolerability issues.
    • CEO Robert Blum says, “While we are deeply disappointed by the results of VITALITY-ALS, we remain committed to people with ALS who are fighting this devastating disease and who need new therapies to slow the decline of respiratory function and muscle strength that are key hallmarks of disease progression. We have decided to suspend the development of tirasemtiv. While we believe that VITALITY-ALS demonstrated pharmacologic activity for the mechanism of action, we also believe that limitations of tirasemtiv may be addressed with our next-generation fast skeletal muscle activator, CK-2127107.  Based on previous Phase 1 clinical studies, we believe CK-2127107 will be better tolerated and potentially more effective than tirasemtiv in patients with ALS and look forward to Phase 2 trial results in 2018.
    • Complete results from VITALITY-ALS will be presented on December 8 at the International ALS/MND Symposium in Boston.
    • The company will host a conference call this morning at 8:30 am ET to discuss the data. Shares will resume trading at 8:00 am ET.
    • Previously: Cytokinetics completes enrollment in late-stage ALS study of tirasemtiv, data readout expected in H2 2017 (Aug. 17, 2016)
    • Update: Shares are down 27% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:55 AM
